thorwin.math.geo

Class Geodetic

  • java.lang.Object
    • thorwin.math.geo.Geodetic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class Geodetic
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Geodetic coordinate on WGS 84 geodetic datum.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • WGS84_EARTH_RADIUS

        public static final double WGS84_EARTH_RADIUS
        The mean radius of the WGS84 spheroid when modelled as a sphere. Some other algorithms use 6371km for the earth's radius, but we use this as this is for WGS84 spheroid.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        longitude - longitude [-PI,PI]

      • haversine

        public static double haversine(double lat0,
                               double lon0,
                               double lat1,
                               double lon1)
        Calculates the great-circle distance between the two locations using the Haversine formula. Average radius of the WGS84 spheroid is used. This is a fast, but quite inaccurate calculation. For a more accurate algorithm, use the vincenty method.
        Parameters:
        lat0 - latitude of first location
        lon0 - longitude of first location
        lat1 - latitude of second location
        lon1 - longitude of second location
        Returns:
        the distance
        See Also:
        Wikipedia on the Haversine formula

      • vincenty

        public static GreatCircleDistance vincenty(double lat0,
                                           double lon0,
                                           double lat1,
                                           double lon1,
                                           int iterations)
        Calculates the great-circle distance and forward/reverse azimuth between two geodetic coordinates using the GreatCircleDistance algorithm. This algorithm can yield very accurate results, as it uses the WGS84 spheriod (and not the approximate sphere).
        Parameters:
        lat0 - latitude of first location
        lon0 - longitude of first location
        lat1 - latitude of second location
        lon1 - longitude of second location
        iterations - maximum number of iterations to use. The formulate needs to converge to a value within 1E-12 with this number of iterations to yield a value.
        Returns:
        vincenty
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the algorithm does not converge within the specified number of iterations.
        See Also:
        Wikipedia on GreatCircleDistance's formulae

      • vincenty

        public static GreatCircleDistance vincenty(double lat0,
                                           double lon0,
                                           double lat1,
                                           double lon1,
                                           double precision,
                                           int iterations)
        Calculates the great-circle distance and forward/reverse azimuth between two geodetic coordinates using the GreatCircleDistance algorithm.This algorithm can yield very accurate results, as it uses the WGS84 spheriod (and not the approximate sphere).
        Parameters:
        lat0 - latitude of first location
        lon0 - longitude of first location
        lat1 - latitude of second location
        lon1 - longitude of second location
        precision - the precision used to stop the iteration. The formula needs to converge within this precision to yield a value.
        iterations - maximum number of iterations to use. The formulate needs to converge to the specified precision with this number of iterations to yield a value.
        Returns:
        vincenty
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the algorithm does not converge within the specified number of iterations.
        See Also:
        Wikipedia on GreatCircleDistance's formulae

      • destination

        public Geodetic destination(double bearing,
                            double distance)
        Calculates the destination. The altitude is preserved, if any. Note that the calculation uses a sphere to model the Earth, which is limited in precision.
        Parameters:
        bearing - bearing to travel in
        distance - distance to travel (in meters)
        Returns:
        the destination

      • destination

        public static Geodetic destination(double lat,
                                   double lon,
                                   double bearing,
                                   double distance)
        Calculates the destination when travelling from the specified location in the direction of the bearing over a distance in meters. Note that the calculation uses a sphere to model the Earth, which is limited in precision.
        Parameters:
        lat - latitude of start
        lon - longitude of start
        bearing - bearing
        distance - distance in meters
        Returns:
        the location

      • hasAltitude

        public boolean hasAltitude()
        Returns:
        true if this geodetic coordinate has a defined altitude

      • distance

        public double distance(double latitude,
                       double longitude)
        Calculates the great-circle distance between this location and the specified location in meters. The Haversine function is used to calculate the distance. If greater than approximately 0.5% accuracy is needed, take a look at the vincenty method.
        Parameters:
        latitude - latitude in radians
        longitude - longitude in radians
        Returns:
        the distance

      • distance

        public double distance(Geodetic to)
        Calculates the great-circle distance between this location and the specified location in meters. The Haversine function is used to calculate the distance. If this coordinate and the parameter coordinate both have a defined altitude, the distance is incremented to account for the difference (using hypotenuse).

        If greater than approximately 0.5% accuracy is needed, take a look at the vincenty method.

        Parameters:
        to - location
        Returns:
        the distance

      • forwardAzimuth

        public double forwardAzimuth(Geodetic to)
        Calculate the forward azimuth
        Parameters:
        to - location
        Returns:
        the forward azimuth

      • forwardAzimuth

        public static double forwardAzimuth(double lat0,
                                    double lon0,
                                    double lat1,
                                    double lon1)
        Calculate the forward azimuth is the initial bearing that will take you from a location to another.
        Parameters:
        lat0 - latitude of first location
        lon0 - longitude of first location
        lat1 - latitude of second location
        lon1 - longitude of second location
        Returns:
        the forward azimuth in the range [-PI,PI]

      • getAltitude

        public double getAltitude()
        Returns the altitude in meters above WGS84 geoid.
        Returns:
        altitude, or NaN if no altitude is known

        public Geodetic midpoint(double latitude,
                         double longitude)
        Calculates the midpoint between the this and the specified location.
        Parameters:
        latitude - latitude in radians
        longitude - longitude in radians
        Returns:
        mid point between this and the other location.

      • midpoint

        public static Geodetic midpoint(double lat0,
                                double lon0,
                                double lat1,
                                double lon1)
        Calculates the midpoint between two geodetic coordinates.
        Parameters:
        lat0 - latitude of first location
        lon0 - longitude of first location
        lat1 - latitude of second location
        lon1 - longitude of second location
        Returns:
        mid-point between two locations

      • midpoint

        public Geodetic midpoint(Geodetic to)
        Calculate the midpoint between the this and the location 'to'. If both geodetic coordinates have a defined altitude, the result will contain the average altitude.
        Parameters:
        to - location
        Returns:
        mid point between this and the other location.

      • toECEF

        public Ecef toECEF()
        Convert to earth-centered-earth-fixed coordinate
        Returns:
        Ecef

      • toECEF

        public static Ecef toECEF(double lat,
                          double lon,
                          double altitude)
        Convert a geodetic coordinate to ECEF
        Parameters:
        lat - latitude in radians
        lon - longitude in radians
        altitude - altitude in meters (if NaN, 0 is assumed)
        Returns:
        coordinate in Earth Centered Earth Fixed (Ecef) coordinate.
